p: Soil analysis ( Table 5) showed that acidity of the tested Entic Podzol was typical of this type of soil (pH KCl = 5.7) and met the requirements of the studied plant community. Analysis also showed that the soil contained relatively low total N. Mineral forms of N (N-NO 3 ‒ and N-NH 4 +) did not contribute substantially to the total N pool (0.99% of total N). Molar N-NH 4 +: N-NO 3 ‒ ratio of 1.57 showed that N-NH 4 + was a predominant N form in the studied soil.
